result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Stanley Sewell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
*Court waived all waiverable cost due to defendant financial instability.
*Court ordered all non waiverable cost including DNA to be paid by 01-30-2018.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

*Mental health evaluation and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Attend and successfully complete cogitative Thinking programming and vocational rehab programming.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in custody.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 37 days time served.  Huber privileges for treatment and or Day Reporting Center if approved by HOC.
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 4 Months in the House of Correction as condition time with Huber privileges for treatment and/or Day Reporting Center if approved by HOC.
-Mental health evaluation and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment 
-Attend and successfully complete cogitative Thinking programming and vocational rehab programming.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

Court waived all waiverable cost due to defendant financial instability.
Court ordered all non waiverable cost including DNA to be paid by 01-30-2018.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.



RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Status conference scheduled for 1/30/2017 at 1:30 p.m. Branch 31 for Branch 47

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return of warrant. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 11/9/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 1/17/2017 at 8:30, in Branch 47.  Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Olya Petukhova in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cae held over from 11-5-15.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  Remand for sentencing.

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (6/18/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark Stanley Sewell
Current: 7732 North 80th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 06-17-2015)
Prior: 7732 North 80th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Oral No Contact Order with Walmart located on 6300 W. Browndeer Road

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mark Stanley Sewell not in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/21/15 @ 1:30pm
